question: From the diagram
images/2024-chem-55-1.png
<katex>$\Delta H$</katex> for the reaction <katex>$C\rightarrow A$</katex> is
explanation: Hess's Law: <katex>$\Delta H(A \rightarrow C) = \Delta H(A \rightarrow 2B) + \Delta H(2B \rightarrow C) = 10 + 25 = 35$</katex>. So <katex>$\Delta H(C \rightarrow A) = -35 J$</katex>.
